channel.title: World
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from World, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Preview Julia Donaldson's joyful tale of love
item.description: Two devoted scarecrows plan the perfect wedding – until a rival threatens everything

item.title: Ukraine war live: Zelenskyy in Ireland to shore up support with US’s Witkoff set to meet Putin
item.description: US-led peace push comes as Kyiv says fighting is continuing over important hub US-Russia talks may pile pressure on Kyiv to make concessions, says EU ...

item.title: Children’s home providers in England putting profit over need, says Ofsted
item.description: Watchdog says trend of care homes being registered in cheap areas, not where need is greatest, is ‘national scandal’ The number of registered children...

item.title: Bid by Gina Rinehart’s company to build helipad set to be blocked by City of Perth
item.description: Hancock says facility is ‘modern necessity’ but opponents argue the noise would disrupt local businesses Get our breaking news email , free app or dai...

item.title: Quarter of police forces missing basic policies on sexual offences, says Sarah Everard report
item.description: Official report says forces in England and Wales yet to implement policies for investigation A quarter of police forces in England and Wales are yet t...

item.title: OBR says it raised concerns with Treasury about pre-budget briefings – UK politics live
item.description: Officials from agency grilled by MPs The former deputy prime minister Angela Rayner will lay an amendment on Wednesday to speed up the workers rights’...

item.title: Media will not stop us enjoying Australia - Stokes
item.description: England will continue to enjoy their time off in Australia during the Ashes despite media scrutiny, says captain Ben Stokes.

item.title: Quarter of police forces lack basic policies for investigating sexual offences, Sarah Everard report finds
item.description: The report, published four years after the murder and rape of Sarah Everard, finds more is needed to prevent violent crime

item.title: Twelve more prisoners released in error, with two still missing, says Lammy
item.description: The releases happened in the past three weeks, coming on top of 91 prisoners who were freed by mistake between April and October.

item.title: Searches for British hiker missing in Romanian mountains
item.description: His rugby club says its thoughts are with him, family and friends in this "incredibly worrying time".
